Thus, it is reasonable to require that 'AD_SanctumStatue' occur before 'AD_SqueletonRoom'.

On the other hand, both 'AD_SanctumStatue' and 'AD_OutsideStatue' involve reading a plaque at the feet of an unidentified statue – but in distinct locations (“Sanctum” vs. “Outside”). This suggests that they are alternative narrative paths. A player’s route likely focuses on one location or the other so that triggering one would logically preclude the other in the same playthrough. (Note that the other sessions, such as 'PAD_RichSarcophagus', 'AD_FL1Mural', and 'AD_TrappedTomb', have distinct locations and subjects—themes of different deities or tombs—and show no clear cause–effect link with the statue sessions.)

Based on these observations, only the above sessions imply ordering or mutual exclusiveness constraints.
